depricated_1.message: Textmarker has been depricated and will no longer be maintained!

depricated_2.message: You can continue using it, but be aware that it might break in some future version of Firefox.

quickbutton_sync.message: ON = sync this entry | OFF = save it locally

kofi.message: Donate via Ko-Fi.com - no registration required - Thank You :)

title_view.message: Open detail view in new window

title_immut.message:
This site has been classified as 'page content will never change' - 
which will result in faster and safer restoration of your highlights.

t1110.message: Content of online pages might change over time, which is why restoring your saved highlights can fail.

t1111.message: If you are 100% certain that a page will always stay exactly the same (i.e., because you saved it - locally or using a service like 'Pocket') you can choose to use a different save method:

t1113.message: When you open the corresp. page you can convert a history entry for immutable pages (or back) by clicking the switch in the sidebar

t1118.message: Just select text and Textmarker will automatically highlight it.

t1119.message: You can change the marker to use in the sidebar under 'Markers'.

t1121.message: As soon as you select some text a small popup with all your markers will appear just above the selection.

t212.message: You have 6 default markers which are the keys M, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.

t213.message: Besides marking text you can use a bunch of shortcuts for different purposes like undo and redo the last highlighting, saving your highlights or turning a highlight into a bookmark.

t215.message: Once you have saved highlights a corresponding entry will be set into Textmarker history.

t216.message: In the history your savings are listed (one entry per page you have saved highlights on).

t217.message: You can delete any entry or save it into a local text file.

t218.message: Your settings and history (saved highlights) will not be synced automatically. You can enable syncing in the corresponding tab.

t221.message: You can enable or disable any Textmarker function and set custom shortcuts.

t222.message: For enabling functions just checkmark them.

t223.message: Shortcuts of Firefox or other applications or extensions can't be overridden anymore.

t224.message: For all shortcuts you can use different key combinations.

t225.message: Some Textmarker functions can be accessed via context menu (the menu that opens with right mouse button if you are not using MacOS).

t231.message: Go to any web page and select some text (i.e. with the left mouse button).

t232.message: Once the text is been selected click a marker key - the text will be highlighted.

t233.message: Keyboard keys that function as markers are by default M, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.

t234.message: If you need more markers than the ones on keys M and 1-5 you can add up to 8 custom markers and style them.

t235.message: In the Settings under 'Markers' you can customize the style for any marker.

t236.message: For example if you want to change the style of the marker that is on key 2 then chose '2' using the uppermost select. Then use the other selects to define background color, text color, text size, font or other stylings.

h241.message: Textmarker functions and how to use them

t241.message: Highlight text that has been selected with left mouse button.

t242.message: Default shortcuts: M, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 - or via context menu

t244.message: Undo the last hightlight you did or redo the last highlight you undid.

t245.message: Default shortcuts: Ctrl + Alt + Z, Ctrl + Alt + Y

t246.message: enabled or disabled by default depending on which version you started with

t247.message: Once you made some highlights you can use Textmarker's save function for having them restored on a future visit of the corresponding site.

t249.message: enabled or disabled by default depending on which version you started with

t2413.message: You can delete any highlight you made.

t2416.message: Choose one of your highlightings to function as a bookmark, which means on a revisit the page will scroll autmatically to this highlight - provided you used Textmarker's save function.

t2417.message: Default shortcut: Ctrl + Alt + B - or via context menu

t2418.message: enabled or disabled by default depending on which version you started with

t2419.message: To delete a bookmark right click on it (that is the corresponding highlight) and choose 'Delete Bookmark'.

t2422.message: After having selected some text with the left mouse button you can look it up on Wikipedia in a new tab by pessing the corresp. shortcut or via contextmenu. Under Settings > Misc you can also define a custom address for looking up a word.

t2423.message: Default: W - or via context menu

t251.message: Once you made some highlights you can use Textmarker's save function for having them restored on a future visit of the corresponding site.

t253.message: enabled or disabled by default depending on which version you started with

t254.message: You can also choose to always automatically save highlights (and bookmarks) without having to use a shortcut.

t255.message: In the Textmarker history you find a list of the pages you saved highlights for.

t256.message: To the right of each entry you see 3 buttons:

t257.message: From left to right they are for:

t259.message: Downloading highlights to a local text file

t2511.message: Deleting the entry (including all saved highlights)

h255.message: Actions on history entries: More specific

t2513.message: You can also checkmark entries and choose an action for them using the select drop-down.

t2514.message: In case you choose 'download' you can define what exactly you want to download:

t2517.message: Only the highlights made with key M, 2 or 3

t2520.message: In the Settings under 'History' you can choose how saved entries will be named: 'automatically' or 'manually' (per shortcut).

t2521.message: You can also decide if an entry is being named by the page's title or by the current date or to type in a name yourself.

t2522.message: Via context-menu (right mouse button) you can add sticky notes to your highlights.

t2523.message: Notes will be saved the same way as your highlights (see also Settings > History for auto-save-mode).

t2524.message: Notes come with 2 buttons, one for deleting and one for hiding the note.

t2525.message: Hidden notes will be displayed via click on the corresp. highlight.

t2526.message: As soon as you made your first note a button for toggling notes will appear at the top-right of the page.

t2527.message: In Settings > Shortcuts you can deactivate the context-menu item for notes.

t2528.message: In Settings > Misc you can deactivate (3) and (4).

h262.message: Error on restoring saved highlights on revisit

t261.message: The content of a site may change after your text marks have been saved.

t262.message: Textmarker only rebuilds text marks of sections that haven't been changed.

t263.message: But this doesn't mean all other marks will go lost.

t264.message: Also, all highlights still exist in your Textmarker history memory, so you can retrieve them via download.

t266.message: You are in Private Browsing Mode. In this mode Textmarker won't save any data concerning your browser history - and therefore no highlights.

t267.message: Save functionality disabled. Enable it in the Settings under 'Shortcuts'.

t2613.message: If something is still not working for you and/or you encountered a bug please contact me via e-mail with a detailed description of what went wrong under which circumstances - and include the error logs!

x241.message: Overrlying marks will be deleted with it !

x242.message: On PDFs you need to be on the page the bookmark is on for scrolling automatically to it.

x251.message: Highlights in iFrames will get a seperate history entry - 1 entry per frame.

x252.message: The restoration of saved highlights can fail for several reasons - especially when the corresp. page's text content chages.

x262.message: You can (de-)activate all shortcus under Settings > Shortcuts.

x264.message: It's generally better to just download the PDF and use the built-in highlighter of your PDF-viewer.

x265.message: All marks, including the ones that can't be restored

x266.message: All lost marks (the ones that can't be restored)

x268.message: Errors that get shown as Firefox notifications will also be listed on the error logs page (last 200).

x269.message: Under 'Contact & Support' you can send the logs via e-mail to the developer.

x2611.message: This can have many reasons, the most likely one being a Firefox crash.

x2612.message: Just send an e-mail to undflybir@gmx.de - maybe your data still persists in memory and can be restored.

t4125.message: When used together with a background color underlinings are not visible in each line if the highlighted text passage has low line spacing.

t4120.message: Are those birches flying over my head?

t4121.message: The following keys are your text markers (14 max.):

t4214.message: Use shortcuts or context menu for highlighting

t4215.message: Show marker popup on text selection

h433.message: How would you like to name your history entries?

t4319.message: By highlighted text / One highlight per entry

t4320.message: For every highlighted text a new history entry will be created.

t4321.message: Unlike with above options multiple entries per URL are allowed.

t4322.message: Attention: You cannot save entries both in this mode and one of the above modes for the same URL.

t4323.message: I save my highlights on immutable pages

t4324.message: If a highlight wasn't restorable: Don't try again next time

t4325.message: Bookmarking and deleting highlights are not available with this option.

t4327.message: Making new highlights after Textmarker wasn't able to restore all previous highlights can result in non-resolvable conflicts at next restoration!

t4328.message: Save highlights on pages with same URL path but different hashes to different entries

t4329.message: If enabled: Textmarker will save highlights on 'https://some-url#somehash' to a different history entry than highlights made on 'https://some-url#someotherhash'.

t4330.message: Caution: Use the same setting for all URLs of same path ('path', 'path#lorem', 'path#ipsum', ...), or else it can result in restoration conflicts.

t4331.message: Automatic 2. attempt after 5 seconds on highlight-restoration failure

t4318.message: Allow saving in private browsing mode

t442.message: Display bookmark button when using a text mark as bookmark (top-right of page - on click: scroll to bookmark)

t444.message: See: Manual > Functions > Use a textmark as bookmark

t445.message: See: Manual > Functions > Lookup selected word

t447.message: Display button for toggling all notes (top-right of page)

t448.message: Click on highlight opens corresp. note

t448c.message: Show header and buttons only if active

t4410.message: Show progressbar during restoration of highlights

t4413.message: If you want to use Textmarker on a page click the page action button inside the browser's address bar:

t4415.message: Note: It might not be obvious if some text content on a page lies within an iFrame.

t451.message: when a new entry has been saved to Textmarker's history -

t451b.message: which means highlights have been saved for the first time on the current page.

t4412.message: Opens dropdown menu with Textmarker page links

t452.message: when highlights of an already existing entry have been deleted or new ones have been added.

t452b.message: Does not apply on autosave enabled.

t453.message: if highlights can't be saved, because you are in private browsing mode.

t454.message: if Textmarker is unable to restore all your saved highlights on page revisit.

t455.message: if an unexpected error occurred (short description included).

t459.message: Hint: Error messages and important notes are also being logged to Textmarker's error logs page.

t456.message: restoring your highlights on page revisit has been successful.

t5122.message: You haven't saved any highlights yet.

t614.message: Here you can download a backup copy of your settings and history (Export).

t615.message: In case you lose your data you can import this backup file.

t620.message: An entry will not be imported if the history already contains an entry with the same name or URL.

t712.message: Please check under 'Troubleshooting' for an answer.

t713.message: Still questions? Found a bug? Birches are flying over your head?

t715.message: You can also post bug reports, problems and suggestions on GitHub:

t719.message: Or send a Textmarker error protocol via e-mail

t720.message: If you enjoy Textmarker please consider making a donation.

t816.message: Textmarker cannot be loaded into websites.

t913.message: Syncing is limited by Firefox to

t914.message: In the history you can also decide later which entries to keep local and which to sync.

t917.message: For syncing extensions you need to open a

t919.message: Please make sure to always sync your Firefox profiles before reloading / opening a page with synced highlights on it.

tA16.message: Doesn't work for PDF or in Reader View

tA110.message: I'm sure I saved my highlights and there is a corresponding entry on the

tA112.message: Please make sure you either have autosave enabled or to save your highlights manually using either a keyboard shortcut or the save button in Textmarker's sidebar.

tA113.message: After having loaded the corresponding website I see a Textmarker notification saying that my highlights couldn't be restored.

tA114.message: Please see the entries on the

tA116.message: Is there a reason given of why the restoration was unsuccessful?

tA117.message: The displayed reason is saying that the text couldn't be found

tA118.message: But the exact same text is on that page

tA119.message: If possible, please attach the corresponding history entry (you can download it on the history page).

tA121.message: Please contact the developer via e-mail.

tA122.message: Please try that and see if it solves the problem

tA123.message: Note: Your highlights might be already lost (depending on your setting for trying to restore lost marks more than once), so you might have to create them again.

tA124.message: Well, if the text isn't on the page anymore Textmarker can't highlight it ;)

tA125.message: Most likely the page's content has changed since your last visit and therefore Textmarker's meta data stored with each highlight fail to find the correct text passages - even though the text might still be on that page.

tA126.message: If this sounds untrue please contact the developer via e-mail

tA128.message: Please make sure you always sync your Firefox profiles, before restoring your highlights.

tA129.message: If this doesn't appear to be the problem:

tA133.message: Highlighting selected text neither works with using shortcuts nor context-menu nor sidebar buttons

tA134.message: The corresponding shortcuts / context-menu options are enabled

tA135.message: There are no entries shown on the

tA138.message: The history seems to be alright

tA139.message: but none of your entries contains any highlights.

tA141.message: If you have seen entries on the history page before and you haven't removed them a possible reason for the loss could be an irregular shutdown (crash) of your browser. Please contakt the developer via e-mail if this doesn't seem true.

tA142.message: In case you are not sure if there have been entries before you possibly haven't saved your highlights. Please enable automatic saving. And in case you are in private browsing mode (PBM): Please enable Textmarker explicitly to store your highlights in PBM (Settings > History).

tA143.message: There is something wrong with your history:

tA146.message: I disabled saving for Private Browsing Mode

tA147.message: Please try with uninstalling Textmarker and re-install it

tA149.message: If that doesn't solve the problem please contact the developer via e-mail.

tA150.message: Please go to some page that hasn't been saved to Textmarker's history yet (i.e. an article on Wikipedia), highlight something and check your history for a newly created entry.

tA151.message: If there is no new entry everything seems to work fine.

tA154.message: Extensions are being blocked from injecting content scripts into PDF viewer or in Reader Mode.

tA155.message: This might change in the future, but for now it's not possible to use Textmarker on those pages.

tA157.message: * This behavior couldn't be reproduced by the developer and most likely this is not due to a bug in Textmarker's source code.

tA158.message: You can enable, disable and customize any shortcut or context menu item under Settings > Shortcuts.

tA159.message: I know, but something isn't working as expected

tA160.message: Please make sure to provide a detailed bug report:

tA163.message: - Which version of Firefox and Textmarker?

tA164.message: - Which operating system (Linux, MacOS, Windows, Android, ...)?

tA165.message: - Other infos that you feel might help

tA166.message: Additional infos that might help with debugging:

tA169.message: - A history entry (if the issue is about highlights and if you are OK with sharing this data)*

tA170.message: * You can export your data on the Import & Export page to a .json file and send this file via e-mail (make sure to remove the history from the file, in case you don't wish to share it with the developer).

tA171.message: Single history entries can also be downloaded on your history page.

tA172.message: Possibly the restoration failed already on your last visit; if repeated restoration trials are disabled in the settings under 'History' Textmarker is treating the entry as being empty.

note_saved_entry.message:
Your highlights have been saved.

Open it via Textmarker icon in navigation bar and choose "History"

note_pbm.message:
Saving failed.
Allow saving in private browsing mode under Settings > History.

note_restoration_failure.message: Was not able to restore all highlights.

note_restoration_failure_reason_2.message: Text found, but doesn't meet saved criteria (c1)

note_restoration_failure_reason_3.message: Text found, but doesn't meet saved criteria (c2)

auto_retry.message: Automatic second restoration attempt in 5 seconds...

note_restoration_warning_1.message:
Found both multi- and single-highlight-entries for this URL.
Restoring the latter only...

note_restoration_warning_2.message:
More than one multi-highlight-entry for this URL found.
Restoring the latest one only...

note_restoration_success.message: Your highlights have been restored successfully!

note_url.message: For security reasons sites with privileged URLs can't be opened programmatically by addons (i.e. file://, chrome://, data://, about:...).

Textmarker Content Script was not being loaded.
Try a page reload.

css_injection_failure.message:
Textmarker Styles were not being loaded.
Try a page reload.

missing_permission_wn.message:
Textmarker doesn't work properly, because you haven't given the permission for: Access browser activity during navigation.
See Error Logs page!

error_empty_synced_storage_onstart.message:
Your synced Textmarker storage is empty.
If this is unexpected then it's likely due to a FF crash.
support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-crashes-troubleshoot-prevent-and-get-help

error_empty_synced_storage_onupdate.message:
Your synced Textmarker storage is empty.
